drug.name: Tromethamine
drug.description: An organic amine proton acceptor. It is used in the synthesis of surface-active agents and pharmaceuticals; as an emulsifying agent for cosmetic creams and lotions, mineral oil and paraffin wax emulsions, as a biological buffer, and used as an alkalizer. (From Merck, 11th ed; Martindale, The Extra Pharmacopoeia, 30th ed, p1424)
drug.synthesis-reference: Jean Bourguignon, Marcel-Xavier Sion, Michel Moreau, "Preparation of tris(hydroxymethyl)aminomethane." U.S. Patent US4233245, issued August, 1959.
drug.indication: For the prevention and correction of metabolic acidosis.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 1,2-aminoalcohols. These are organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.

mixture.name: Sooryehan Hyo Fermented Sun Block
mixture.ingredients: Amiloxate + Bemotrizinol + Diethylamino hydroxybenzoyl hexyl benzoate + Ensulizole + Octinoxate + Titanium dioxide + Tromethamine

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Flecainide
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Flecainide can be increased when it is combined with Tromethamine.

target.name: Autolysin
target.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Autolysin
polypeptide.specific-function: Autolysins are involved in some important biological processes such as cell separation, cell-wall turnover, competence for genetic transformation, formation of the flagella and sporulation. Autolysin strictly depends on the presence of choline-containing cell walls for activity.
polypeptide.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

go-classifier.description: sporulation resulting in formation of a cellular spore

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c4
polypeptide.specific-function: Diheme, high potential cytochrome c believed to be an intermediate electron donor to terminal oxidation systems.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Soluble calcium-activated nucleotidase 1
polypeptide.specific-function: Calcium-dependent nucleotidase with a preference for UDP. The order of activity with different substrates is UDP > GDP > UTP > GTP. Has very low activity towards ADP and even lower activity towards ATP. Does not hydrolyze AMP and GMP. Involved in proteoglycan synthesis.

go-classifier.description: positive regulation of I-kappaB kinase/NF-kappaB signaling

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Lipoprotein NlpI
polypeptide.specific-function: May be involved in cell division. May play a role in bacterial septation or regulation of cell wall degradation during cell division. Negatively controls the production of extracellular DNA (eDNA).

polypeptide.name: DNA protection during starvation protein
polypeptide.specific-function: Protects DNA from oxidative damage by sequestering intracellular Fe(2+) ion and storing it in the form of Fe(3+) oxyhydroxide mineral, which can be released after reduction. It efficiently inhibits hydroxyl radical production by the Fenton reaction. Does not bind DNA.

target.name: Putative glucose-6-phosphate 1-epimerase
target.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

polypeptide.name: Putative glucose-6-phosphate 1-epimerase
polypeptide.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

synonyms.synonym: DNA-(apurinic or apyrimidinic site) lyase Neil1

go-classifier.description: DNA-(apurinic or apyrimidinic site) lyase activity
hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds

target.name: Cholera enterotoxin subunit B
target.organism: Vibrio cholerae serotype O1 (strain ATCC 39315 / El Tor Inaba N16961)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Cholera enterotoxin subunit B
polypeptide.specific-function: The B subunit pentameric ring directs the A subunit to its target by binding to the GM1 gangliosides present on the surface of the intestinal epithelial cells. It can bind five GM1 gangliosides. It has no toxic activity by itself.
polypeptide.organism: Vibrio cholerae serotype O1 (strain ATCC 39315 / El Tor Inaba N16961)

go-classifier.description: killing of cells of other organism
positive regulation of tyrosine phosphorylation of Stat3 protein

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase proenzyme
polypeptide.specific-function: Essential for biosynthesis of the polyamines spermidine and spermine. Promotes maintenance and self-renewal of embryonic stem cells, by maintaining spermine levels (By similarity).

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Biotin synthase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the conversion of dethiobiotin (DTB) to biotin by the insertion of a sulfur atom into dethiobiotin via a radical-based mechanism.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.
Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Vascular endothelial growth factor A
polypeptide.general-function: Vascular endothelial growth factor receptor binding
polypeptide.specific-function: Growth factor active in angiogenesis, vasculogenesis and endothelial cell growth. Induces endothelial cell proliferation, promotes cell migration, inhibits apoptosis and induces permeabilization of blood vessels. Binds to the FLT1/VEGFR1 and KDR/VEGFR2 receptors, heparan sulfate and heparin. NRP1/Neuropilin-1 binds isoforms VEGF-165 and VEGF-145. Isoform VEGF165B binds to KDR but does not activate downstream signaling pathways, does not activate angiogenesis and inhibits tumor growth.
